workflow.name: Auto send thank-you messages & loyalty coupons via WhatsApp from Shopify using Rapiwa
workflow.description:
# Shopify Auto Send WhatsApp Thank-You Messages & Loyalty Coupon Using Rapiwa API

## Who is this for?
This workflow is for Shopify store owners, marketers, and support teams who want to automatically message their high-value customers on WhatsApp when new discount codes are created.

## What this workflow does
- Fetches customer data from Shopify
- Filters customers where `total_spent > 5000`
- Cleans phone numbers (removes non-digit characters) and normalizes them to an international format
- Verifies numbers via the Rapiwa API (`verify-whatsapp` endpoint)
- Sends coupon or thank-you messages to verified numbers via the Rapiwa `send-message` endpoint
- Logs each send attempt to Google Sheets with `status` and `validity`
- Uses batching (SplitInBatches) and Wait nodes to avoid rate limits

## Key features
- Automated trigger: Shopify webhook (`discounts/create`) or manual trigger
- Targeted sending to high-value customers
- Pre-send verification to reduce failed sends
- Google Sheets logging and status updates
- Rate-limit protection using Wait node

#How to use?
## Step-by-step setup
1) Prepare a Google Sheet
   - Columns: `name`, `number`, `status`, `validity`, `check` (optional)
   - Example row: `Abdul Mannan | 8801322827799 | not sent | unverified | check`

2) Configure n8n credentials
   - Shopify: store access token (X-Shopify-Access-Token)
   - Rapiwa: Bearer token (HTTP Bearer credential)
   - Google Sheets: OAuth2 credentials and sheet access

3) Configure the nodes
   - Webhook/Trigger: Shopify `discounts/create` or Manual Trigger
   - HTTP Request (Shopify): `/admin/api/<version>/customers.json`
   - Code node: filter customers `total_spent > 5000` and map fields
   - SplitInBatches: batching/looping
   - Code (clean number): `waNoStr.replace(/\D/g, "")`
   - HTTP Request (Rapiwa verify): POST `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/verify-whatsapp` body `{ number }`
   - IF node: check `data.exists` to decide branch
   - HTTP Request (Rapiwa send-message): POST `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/send-message` body `{ number, message_type, message }`
   - Google Sheets Append/Update: write `status` and `validity`
   - Wait: add 2‚Äì5 seconds delay between sends

4) Test with a small batch
   - Run manually with 2‚Äì5 records first and verify results

## Google Sheet column structure
**A Google Sheet** formatted like this ‚û§ [Sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1q5mO2pRCdO-v51OyUZt-56UprsGpmn0PMGhnglgg2ls/edit?usp=sharing)
| Name  | Number  | Status   | Validity   |
| -------------- | ------------- | -------- | ---------- |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801322827798 | not sent | unverified |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801322827799 | sent     | verified   |

## Requirements
- Shopify Admin API access (store access token)
- Rapiwa account and Bearer token
- Google account and Google Sheet (OAuth2 setup)
- n8n instance (nodes used: HTTP Request, Code, SplitInBatches, IF, Google Sheets, Wait)

## Customization ideas
- Adjust the filter (e.g., order count, customer tags)
- Use message templates to insert name and coupon code per customer
- Add an SMS or email fallback for unverified numbers
- Send a run summary to admin (Slack / email)
- Store logs in a database for deeper analysis

## Important notes
- `data.exists` may be a boolean or a string ‚Äî normalize it in a Code node before using in an IF node
- Ensure Google Sheets column names match exactly
- Store Rapiwa and Shopify tokens securely in n8n credentials
- Start with small batches for testing and scale gradually

## Useful Links
- **Dashboard:** [https://app.rapiwa.com](https://app.rapiwa.com/login)
- **Official Website:** [https://rapiwa.com](https://rapiwa.com/)
- **Documentation:** [https://docs.rapiwa.com](https://docs.rapiwa.com/)


## Support & Help
- **WhatsApp**: [Chat on WhatsApp](https://wa.me/8801322827799)
- **Discord**: [SpaGreen Community](https://discord.gg/SsCChWEP)
- **Facebook Group**: [SpaGreen Support](https://www.facebook.com/groups/spagreenbd)
- **Website**: [https://spagreen.net](https://spagreen.net)
- **Developer Portfolio**: [Codecanyon SpaGreen](https://codecanyon.net/user/spagreen/portfolio)

nodes.name: Get All Customer Data In Store

parameters.content:
## Node: Clicki (Manual Trigger)  
**Purpose**:  
Starts the workflow manually when you want to run it.

## 1. Node: Get All Customer Data In Store  
**Purpose**:  
Fetches all customer data from your Shopify store using Shopify API.
`your_shopify_accesstoken like this‚û°Ô∏èshpat_57xx78xxxxx90fxxx67
`

## 2. Node: Clean HTTP Request Data  
**Purpose**:  
Filters and processes Shopify customer data to only keep customers who have spent more than 5000 units. Extracts key customer info like name, phone, email, total spent, and address.

## Node: Loop Over Items (Split in Batches)  
**Purpose**:  
Splits the customer list into smaller batches to process each customer individually or in groups.

## 1. Node: Clean WhatsApp Number (Code Node)  
**Purpose**:  
Cleans up the phone numbers by removing non-digit characters to format the number properly for WhatsApp verification.

## 2. Node: Check valid whatsapp number Using Rapiwa  
**Purpose**:  
Checks if the cleaned phone number is a valid WhatsApp number by calling the Rapiwa API.

## 1. Node: If (Condition Check)  
**Purpose**:  
Checks the Rapiwa API response to see if the phone number is verified as a WhatsApp number.

## 2. Node: Send Message Using Rapiwa  
**Purpose**:  
Sends a personalized discount message via WhatsApp to customers with verified WhatsApp numbers.

## 3. Node: Append Rows in Sheet Verified & Sent  
**Purpose**:  
Logs details of customers with verified WhatsApp numbers and sent messages into a Google Sheet.

## 4. Node: Append Rows in Sheet Unverified & Not sent  
**Purpose**:  
Logs customers with unverified WhatsApp numbers and marks them as ‚Äúnot sent‚Äù in the Google Sheet.

## 5. Node: Wait  
**Purpose**:  
Pauses the workflow briefly to avoid hitting API rate limits before processing the next batch of customers.

# Shopify Auto Send WhatsApp Thank-You Messages & Loyalty Coupon Using Rapiwa API

## Overview
This workflow retrieves all customers from a Shopify store, filters customers who have spent over 5000, cleans and standardizes WhatsApp phone numbers, validates numbers via the Rapiwa API, sends personalized WhatsApp messages to verified numbers, and logs verified and unverified numbers into separate Google Sheets tabs. It uses batching and wait delays to manage API rate limits.

## Features
- Fetches customer data automatically from Shopify
- Filters high-value customers (total spent > 5000)
- Cleans phone numbers by removing non-digit characters
- Validates WhatsApp registration status using Rapiwa API
- Conditional logic to handle verified vs unverified numbers
- Sends promotional WhatsApp messages to verified contacts
- Logs results to Google Sheets with status and validity tags
- Includes a delay to prevent API throttling and sheet write conflicts
- Loops over customers in batches for efficient processing

## Requirements
- Shopify store access with API token
- Rapiwa API account with valid bearer token
- Google Sheets account with OAuth2 credentials connected in n8n
- Google Sheet prepared with appropriate columns (see below)
- n8n instance with nodes enabled: HTTP Request, Code, Split In Batches, IF, Google Sheets, Wait
- Phone numbers must be in a format suitable for cleaning and verification

## n8n Credentials
- Shopify Access Token: For API calls to fetch customer data
- Rapiwa Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE: For WhatsApp number verification and messaging
- Google Sheets OAuth2 Credentials: To append rows to your spreadsheet


## Google Sheet format (example rows)
- **A Google Sheet** formatted like this ‚û§ [Sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1q5mO2pRCdO-v51OyUZt-56UprsGpmn0PMGhnglgg2ls/edit?usp=sharing)

| Name  | Number  | Status   | Validity   |
| -------------- | ------------- | -------- | ---------- |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801322827798 | not sent | unverified |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801322827799 | sent     | verified   |


Note: Ensure these columns exist exactly as specified for the append operation to work.

## Nodes Used in the Workflow
- Manual Trigger ‚Äî starts the workflow manually
- HTTP Request (Shopify) ‚Äî fetch all customer data
- Code ‚Äî filter customers by spend and clean customer data
- Split In Batches ‚Äî process customers one by one
- Code ‚Äî clean and format WhatsApp numbers
- HTTP Request (Rapiwa Verify) ‚Äî check if number is registered on WhatsApp
- IF ‚Äî branch workflow based on verification result
- HTTP Request (Rapiwa Send Message) ‚Äî send WhatsApp message to verified numbers
- Google Sheets Append ‚Äî log verified numbers as sent
- Google Sheets Append ‚Äî log unverified numbers as not sent
- Wait ‚Äî add delay between processing batches

## How to Use This Workflow
1. Trigger the workflow manually or set up a scheduler if needed.
2. The workflow fetches all customers from Shopify automatically.
3. Filters customers whose total spending exceeds 5000.
4. Cleans each customer's WhatsApp phone number.
5. Verifies the WhatsApp number via Rapiwa API.
6. If verified, sends a promotional message via WhatsApp.
7. Logs the verified customers with "sent" status in Google Sheets.
8. If not verified, logs them with "not sent" status.
9. Adds a wait period before processing the next customer to avoid rate limits.
10. Repeats until all customers are processed.

## Customization Ideas
- Modify filtering criteria (e.g., based on order count or location)
- Change the WhatsApp message template to suit your brand voice
- Add additional data points to Google Sheets (email, city, country)
- Integrate with other messaging APIs or CRM platforms
- Add error handling for API failures
- Adjust batch sizes and wait times for performance tuning

## Notes & Warnings
- Ensure your Shopify API token has permissions to read customers
- Rapiwa API limits may require adjusting wait times or batch sizes
- Phone numbers must be consistent and cleaned for best validation accuracy
- Google Sheets columns and sheet IDs must be correctly set
- Keep sensitive credentials secure; avoid exposing bearer tokens
- Test with a small data set before scaling up
- This workflow is designed for customers with a high total spend; adjust filters as needed

## Useful Links
- **Dashboard:** [https://app.rapiwa.com](https://app.rapiwa.com/login)
- **Official Website:** [https://rapiwa.com](https://rapiwa.com/)
- **Documentation:** [https://docs.rapiwa.com](https://docs.rapiwa.com/)

## Support & Help
- **WhatsApp**: [Chat on WhatsApp](https://wa.me/8801322827799)
- **Discord**: [SpaGreen Community](https://discord.gg/SsCChWEP)
- **Facebook Group**: [SpaGreen Support](https://www.facebook.com/groups/spagreenbd)
- **Website**: [https://spagreen.net](https://spagreen.net)
- **Developer Portfolio**: [Codecanyon SpaGreen](https://codecanyon.net/user/spagreen/portfolio)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
